Merge pull request #154 from iFixit/barcode-scanner

Add barcode scanner

Navigation: Simplify item creation

Using the enums directly is less error prone and makes comparison
easier.

Navigation alerts: Use a single function

One function can be used to determine whether or not to warn the user
before navigating away and retrieving the AlertDialog.

Refactor Navigation enum

Navigation is renamed to NavigationItem because it represents a single
item in the navigation drawer. Now it contains all the information
needed to perform navigation. It can either have an Activity class to
launch with intent flags, a URL to view, or an Action to run arbitrary
code.

Combine Item and Category with NavigationItem

Now all of the data is stored in Navigation item and the list is
constructed by iterating over the enums and sending it off to the
adapter. The massive block of code that adds Items and Categories is now
gone!

Topic hierarchy: Use display titles

Now display titles are respected when drilling down the content
hierarchy.

Barcode scanner: Don't display multiple dialogs

If mGuideid == -1 that means that there was an error during the guideid
parsing so we don't want to try to fetch guideid -1 and display another
dialog.

Includes the theme generation scripts.

Big rename/reorginization of API classes

Most notable changes are changing 'API' in class names to 'Api' and
moving all API classes to the api package.

Move ApiCall factory methods to ApiCall

Just so Api isn't so polluted.

API: Use an AsyncTask rather than a Service

Long running background services were once strongly recommended against
by the Android developer docs. I can no longer find the article that
stated that, though.

In any case, using a Service to perform API calls is a bit heavy handed.
The actual request was performed in an AsyncTask inside the Service
anyway. All it really did was add an extra layer of complexity:

1. An Intent had to be created to start the service.
1. Arguments were serialized and unserialized.
1. Retrying dead events required Activities to bind to the service and
use interprocess communication.

Additionally, ApiService was kept alive and running for weeks after the
app was closed unless the user explicitly killed the app.

Converting ApiService to a class with static methods only resulted in
simplifications and performance improvements. One motiviation to use a
Service was to use it to download guides for offline storage. The backup
framework already has a nice system for handling that so it would only
cause problems to try and use ApiService to do the background work.

Merge simplify-navigation-selection (#165) into master

Simplify navigation drawer item creation

This pull addresses a few problems with how we previoiusly had navigation
set up:

1. There was a large block of code to add items and another one to respond
to click events.
1. The items were referenced by String so there wasn't any type safety
ensuring that the menu items named existed in the enum.
1. Many Objects were allocated every time the menu drawer is rebuilt.
This happens frequently and results in garbage collection working
overtime to clean everything up.
1. Each menu item handled the click event manually. For most menu items,
an Activity needed to be launched. This resulted in lots of duplicated
boilerplate code.

Api: Remove useless activityid check

This will never happen because BaseActivity always initialzes the
activityid to something greater than -1.

Proguard: Run in release

For us, the primary benefit of running proguard is to remove unused
methods. This is particularly important to remove library code that we
never reference.

This drops APK size of iFixit from 3.5MB to 3.1MB and Dozuki from
4.7MB to 4.1MB.

Search: Fix results pagination

Fixes #172. I don't know what I was thinking before with the change that
broke this.. We need to notify the adapter every time setSearchResults is

Add replacement type to subject check

Fixes #175.  We added the replacement type a while ago, but forgot to add it to
the type check list so the subject field wasn't being populated on Replacement
guides.

Add replacement type to hasSubject check

Fixes #173.

Display error Toast if launching the camera fails

Some devices require physical external storage to request the external
storage directory. When it doesn't exist, native apps such as the camera
decide to stop the user from taking pictures because there isn't a place
to store it. We weren't displaying an error message in this case so it
was really awkward to the user.

Media Manager: Fix images disappearing on rotate

On some devices, changing orientation caused the user's images to
disappear. This was caused by some strange side effect of setting
android:configChanges to orientation.
